definition: Mongol ethnic group/abbr. for Mongolia 蒙古國|蒙古国[Meng3 gu3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Meng2]
to cover/ignorant/to suffer (misfortune)/to receive (a favor)/to cheat

sentences.english: “If I have found grace in thy sight, show me thy glory”(Exod.33:13)
sentences.chinese: 我如今若在禰眼前蒙恩，求禰將禰的道指示我。

sentences.english: Who found favour before God, and desired to find a tabernacle for the God of Jacob.
sentences.chinese: 大衛在神面前蒙恩，祈求爲雅各的神豫備居所。

sentences.english: Then she said, Let me find favour in thy sight, my lord;
sentences.chinese: 路得說，我主阿，願在你眼前蒙恩。

sentences.english: Then she said, Let me find favor in thy sight, my lord;
sentences.chinese: 路得說，我主阿，願在你眼前蒙恩。

sentences.english: But to each one of us grace has been given as Christ apportioned it.
sentences.chinese: 我們各人蒙恩，都是照基督所量給各人的恩賜。

sentences.english: Just let me find favor in the eyes of my lord.
sentences.chinese: 只要在我主眼前蒙恩就是了。

sentences.english: But unto every one of us is given grace according to the measure of the gift of Christ.
sentences.chinese: 我們各人蒙恩，都是照基督所量給各人的恩賜。

sentences.english: How precious did that grace appear, The hour I first believed.
sentences.chinese: 初信之時，我蒙恩許慰，真是何等寶貴。

sentences.english: And Ziba said, I humbly beseech thee that I may find grace in thy sight, my lord, O king.
sentences.chinese: 洗巴說，我叩拜我主我王，願我在你眼前蒙恩。

sentences.english: "May I continue to find favor in your eyes, my lord," she said.
sentences.chinese: 路得說，我主阿，願在你眼前蒙恩。

sentences.english: By living a life of grace.
The life of Christ is the life of grace.
sentences.chinese: 基督的生活即是得勝蒙恩的生活。

sentences.english: How will anyone know that you are pleased with me and with your people unless you go with us?
sentences.chinese: 人在何事上得以知道我和你的百姓在你眼前蒙恩呢？

sentences.english: And David sware moreover, and said, Thy father certainly knoweth that I have found grace in thine eyes;
sentences.chinese: 大衛又起誓說，你父親準知我在你眼前蒙恩。

sentences.english: And he said, What needeth it? let me find grace in the sight of my lord.
sentences.chinese: 雅各說，何必呢，只要在我主眼前蒙恩就是了。

sentences.english: This is living the life of grace.

definition: (third person pronoun for a divine being)
